Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Audition \Au*di"tion\, n. [L. auditio.] The act of hearing or listening; hearing. [1913 Webster]
Audition may be active or passive; hence the difference between listening and simple hearing. --Dunglison. [1913 Webster]

audition n 1: the ability to hear; the auditory faculty; "his hearing was impaired" [syn: {hearing}, {auditory sense}, {sense of hearing}, {auditory modality}] 2: a test of the suitability of a performer [syn: {tryout}] v : perform in order to get a role; "She auditioned for a role on Broadway" [syn: {try out}]
